articles.author: Matthew Belloni ,Eriq Gardner ,Ashley Cullins
articles.title: Bill Cosby Mistrial: Hollywood Reporter Legal Experts Debate How It Happened and What's Next
articles.description: "Are either of you surprised? Can’t say I am," says THR senior editor Eriq Gardner as a trio of trial watchers discuss the reasons for the hung jury, the celebrity factor and whether a re-trial makes sense: "It’s always nearly impossible to predict what a dozen jurors are going to decide."

articles.title: Missing U.S. sailors found dead after collision with merchant ship off coast of Japan
articles.description: A number of the sailors were found in the berthing compartments of the ship that flooded after the collision, which occurred in the early hours of Saturday morning.

articles.title: Trump’s Cuba policy tries to redefine ‘good’ U.S. tourism. That includes putting visitors back on tour buses.
articles.description: Package tours and cruise ships could end up aiding the Cuban government and snubbing the entrepreneurial Cubans favored by Washington.

articles.title: Prince George and Princess Charlotte steal the show - again- at Queen Elizabeth’s 91st birthday celebration
articles.description:
The British royal family celebrated Queen Elizabeth's 91st birthday at the annual Trooping the Colour ceremony in London on Saturday -- but all eyes were on the little Prince George and Princess Charlotte throughout the event.
Once again, the two adorable children of Prince William and Princess...

articles.title: Colombia: Bombing at mall kills 3, including French woman
articles.description: A bomb rocked one of the busiest shopping centers in Colombia's capital Saturday, killing three people, including a 23-year-old French woman, and injuring nine others. Witnesses told of being evacuated from movie theaters and stores after the blast in a second-floor women's restroom at the...

articles.author: http://www.thedailybeast.com/authors/tom-sykes
articles.title: The British Establishment Has a Qatar Problem
articles.description: The super-rich al-Thanis, who sponsor Royal Ascot, love Britain for stardust of centuries-old tradition—while the British establishment revels in the benefits of Qatari wealth.
